title: Medical Educator Ethics: Professionalism Enhancement Through Flipped Learning and Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic ethical knowledge in healthcare/education and clinical experience
context.additional_context: Focus on analyzing conflict situations between educator and patient care provider roles in medical settings and improving ethical decision-making skills

learning_goals: Learners can apply ethical principles—autonomy, beneficence, non-maleficence, and justice—to peer interactions through flipped learning.
In simulated environments, learners can analyze ethical dilemmas in balancing patient care and educational responsibilities and propose solutions.
Using VR-based scenarios, learners can design and implement personalized educational strategies tailored to diverse learner needs.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
